definitions: elongated lettuce with crisp leaves and mild flavor used in salads
examples: Caesar salad traditionally requires fresh romaine lettuce leaves
She grew romaine in her vegetable garden every spring

definitions: person from ancient Rome or relating to that civilization
upright typeface style standard in printing and typography
examples: The Roman citizens enjoyed watching gladiator fights at the Colosseum
Ancient Roman architecture influences modern building designs today
Most books are printed using roman type for the main text
The designer chose roman rather than italic for better readability

definitions: emotional attraction and courtship between people involving love and intimacy
literary or artistic work dealing with heroic or mysterious adventures
group of languages derived from Latin including French Spanish and Italian
examples: Their whirlwind romance led to marriage within six months
The office romance became complicated when they broke up
She preferred reading romance novels during her summer vacation
Medieval romance literature featured knights and damsels in distress
Romance languages share many similarities in grammar and vocabulary
Students studied the evolution of Romance languages from Latin

definitions: person characterized by idealized views of love and emotional expression
artist or writer associated with the Romanticism movement of the late 18th century
examples: He's such a romantic who believes in true love at first sight
The hopeless romantic planned elaborate surprises for every anniversary
Byron was a leading Romantic poet of the early nineteenth century
The Romantics emphasized emotion and nature over reason and order

definitions: European artistic and intellectual movement emphasizing emotion, nature, and individualism from late 18th century
quality of being idealistic, imaginative, or unrealistic about love and life
examples: Romanticism revolutionized poetry and painting in the nineteenth century
The museum's exhibit traces Romanticism from Germany to England
His romanticism about rural life faded after actually farming for a year
Critics dismissed her business plan as pure romanticism without practical foundation

definitions: boisterous play or frolic especially by children or animals
effortless win or success in a competition or contest
examples: The puppies enjoyed their daily romp in the backyard
Children's romp through the playground lasted all afternoon
The championship game became a romp with a twenty-point lead
Her election victory was a romp over weak opposition

definitions: structure covering the top of a building protecting from weather elements
upper limit or ceiling of something such as prices or capabilities
examples: The storm damaged several shingles on their roof last night
Workers installed solar panels across the entire roof surface
Gas prices hit the roof during the summer driving season
The coach said there's no roof on this team's potential

definitions: materials used to construct or cover a roof such as shingles or tiles
professional work of building, repairing, or maintaining roofs on structures
examples: The contractor recommended metal roofing for better durability
Asphalt roofing remains popular due to its affordability
His roofing business expanded rapidly after the hailstorm
Professional roofing requires proper safety equipment and training

definitions: flat or accessible upper surface of a building's roof used for various purposes
examples: The restaurant's rooftop offers panoramic views of the city
They installed a rooftop garden to grow vegetables organically

definitions: castle-shaped chess piece that moves horizontally or vertically on the board
large black crow-like bird common in Europe and Asia
examples: She moved her rook to protect the king from checkmate
The endgame involved skillful maneuvering of rooks and pawns
Rooks nested in the tall trees surrounding the old church
The farmer watched rooks feeding in his freshly plowed field

definitions: professional athlete in their first year of major league competition
person new to a particular job, activity, or situation lacking experience
examples: The rookie quarterback exceeded all expectations this season
Baseball rookies compete for the Rookie of the Year award
Don't worry about mistakes since you're still a rookie here
The rookie police officer learned quickly from veteran partners

definitions: enclosed area within a building separated by walls and used for specific purposes
space or scope for something to happen, exist, or improve
examples: The hotel room overlooked the ocean with a spectacular view
Each child had their own room for privacy and studying
There's room for improvement in your presentation skills
The budget leaves little room for unexpected expenses

definitions: person who shares a living space such as an apartment or dormitory room with another
examples: Her college roommate became her lifelong best friend
Finding a compatible roommate can reduce living expenses significantly

definitions: place where birds regularly settle to rest or sleep especially at night
informal term for a place where someone lives or sleeps
examples: Chickens returned to their roost as darkness approached
The barn provided a safe roost for dozens of pigeons
After traveling for months, he returned to his old roost
Students headed back to their roosts after the party ended

definitions: adult male domestic chicken known for its distinctive crow and colorful plumage
examples: The rooster crowed loudly at dawn every morning
Their prize rooster won first place at the county fair

definitions: underground part of a plant that absorbs water and nutrients from soil
fundamental source, basis, or cause of something existing or happening
number that produces a given number when multiplied by itself specified times
examples: Tree roots can damage sidewalks and building foundations
The plant developed strong roots in the fertile soil
Fear is often the root of aggressive behavior patterns
Investigators searched for the root of the system failure
The square root of sixteen equals four
Students learned to calculate cube roots without calculators

definitions: process of a plant developing roots or cuttings establishing root systems
act of enthusiastically supporting or cheering for someone or something
examples: Rooting hormone helps cuttings develop roots more quickly
The rooting process takes several weeks in proper conditions
Fans spent the afternoon rooting for their home team
Everyone was rooting for her success in the competition

definitions: strong thick cord made by twisting together strands of fiber or wire
cord used to mark boundaries or restrict access to areas
examples: Climbers checked their rope carefully before ascending the cliff
The sailor coiled the rope neatly on the ship's deck
Security placed ropes to control the crowd at the concert
Red velvet ropes marked the VIP section of the club

definitions: person skilled in using a lasso to catch livestock especially in rodeos
person who makes or works with ropes in manufacturing or maritime industries
examples: The champion roper caught the calf in record time
Professional ropers practice their technique for hours daily
The ship's roper repaired damaged rigging before departure
Traditional ropers still hand-twist fibers into strong cords

definitions: sport or skill of catching livestock with a lasso especially in rodeos
act of securing or binding something using ropes
examples: Team roping requires coordination between two riders
She practiced roping techniques at the ranch every weekend
The roping of cargo prevented shifting during transport
Proper roping techniques ensure safety in construction work

definitions: string of beads used in Catholic prayer to count repetitions of prayers
form of prayer in Catholic tradition using beads to guide meditation sequences
examples: Her grandmother's rosary was made of polished wooden beads
The priest blessed the new rosaries at Sunday mass
They gathered to pray the rosary every evening during Lent
The rosary devotion includes meditation on biblical mysteries

definitions: flowering shrub with thorny stems producing fragrant blooms in various colors
light pink to deep red color resembling the flower
past tense form of the verb rise indicating upward movement
examples: Red roses symbolize love and passion in many cultures
The garden featured antique rose varieties from France
She painted the nursery walls a soft rose color
The bridesmaids wore dresses in dusty rose
Stock prices rose steadily throughout the trading day
The sun rose over the mountains at six-thirty

definitions: rose flower before it opens showing tightly furled petals
small decorative element shaped like an unopened rose used in design
examples: The rosebud slowly opened into a magnificent bloom
Florists often prefer rosebuds for corsages and boutonnieres
The wedding cake featured delicate rosebud decorations
Victorian furniture often included carved rosebud motifs

definitions: aromatic evergreen herb with needle-like leaves used in cooking and medicine
traditional female given name derived from the Latin meaning dew of the sea
examples: Fresh rosemary adds wonderful flavor to roasted lamb
The garden path was lined with fragrant rosemary bushes
Rosemary joined the company as the new marketing director
His aunt Rosemary lived in a cottage by the sea

definitions: circular arrangement of ribbon or fabric resembling a rose used as decoration or award
circular arrangement of leaves radiating from a central point in plants
examples: The prize-winning horse wore a blue rosette
Rosettes decorated the Victorian curtains and upholstery
The succulent displayed a perfect rosette of fleshy leaves
Dandelions grow in a rosette pattern close to the ground

definitions: dark reddish-brown hardwood from tropical trees valued for furniture and musical instruments
examples: The antique piano featured beautiful rosewood veneer
Brazilian rosewood is now protected due to over-harvesting

definitions: solid amber residue obtained from pine trees used for violin bows and grip enhancement
examples: The violinist applied rosin to her bow before performing
Baseball pitchers use rosin bags to improve their grip

definitions: official list of people belonging to a team, organization, or group
schedule showing when people are assigned to work or perform duties
examples: The coach announced the final roster for the championship
Company rosters included all employees and their departments
The duty roster assigned nurses to different shifts
Military rosters detailed patrol assignments for the week

definitions: raised platform or podium from which someone speaks to an audience
projecting beak or snout of an animal especially birds or ancient ships
examples: The speaker approached the rostrum to address the assembly
Dignitaries sat behind the rostrum during the ceremony
The bird's rostrum was perfectly adapted for catching fish
Roman warships had bronze rostrums for ramming enemies

definitions: process of decomposition in organic matter caused by bacteria or fungi
foolish or meaningless talk or ideas considered worthless
examples: Wood rot damaged the deck after years of moisture exposure
Compost relies on controlled rot to create nutrient-rich soil
Don't believe that rot about overnight success formulas
The politician's promises were nothing but rot

definitions: list or schedule showing turns of duty or service especially in British usage
examples: The cleaning rota assigned different teams to each floor
Doctors checked the on-call rota for weekend shifts

definitions: mechanical device that operates by rotating or spinning around an axis
international service organization of business and professional leaders
examples: The rotary engine design differs from traditional piston engines
Old rotary phones required dialing each number manually
The Rotary Club sponsored scholarships for local students
Business leaders joined Rotary to network and serve communities

definitions: movement of an object turning around an axis or center point
regular alternation of people, crops, or things in a recurring sequence
examples: Earth's rotation creates day and night cycles
The wheel's rotation powered the mill's grinding stones
Crop rotation improves soil health and reduces pests
Staff rotation ensures everyone gains varied experience

definitions: mechanical or habitual repetition of something to be learned without understanding
examples: Students complained that rote memorization didn't help understanding
Learning multiplication tables by rote remains common practice

definitions: rotating part of a machine especially in motors, turbines, or helicopters
examples: The helicopter's main rotor provides lift for flight
Brake rotors must be replaced when they become too worn

definitions: ongoing process of organic decomposition through bacterial or fungal action
examples: The rotting fruit attracted flies to the compost bin
Rotting wood weakened the old barn's structural integrity

definitions: round building or room especially one with a dome used for public gatherings
examples: The Capitol rotunda features a magnificent painted dome
Wedding guests gathered in the hotel's marble rotunda

definitions: red or pink cosmetic powder or cream applied to cheeks for color
examples: Victorian ladies applied rouge sparingly to avoid looking improper
The makeup artist used rouge to create a healthy glow

definitions: preliminary version or sketch not yet refined or polished
areas of long grass bordering fairways on a golf course
examples: The editor reviewed the rough of the article before revisions
Artists often start with roughs before creating final pieces
His ball landed in the rough requiring a difficult shot
The rough at this course is particularly challenging

definitions: casino game where a ball spins on a numbered wheel determining winning bets
examples: The roulette wheel landed on red seventeen
Playing roulette in Monte Carlo was her vacation highlight

definitions: something shaped like a circle or sphere without angles
complete sequence or cycle of events, activities, or drinks
single unit of ammunition for a firearm
examples: Children sat in a round on the classroom carpet
The table's round shape encouraged group conversation
The doctor completed her morning rounds at the hospital
Everyone bought a round of drinks at the pub
The hunter carried fifty rounds of ammunition
Each round must be accounted for at the range

definitions: circular intersection where traffic flows around a central island
examples: The roundabout reduced accidents at the busy intersection
Drivers must yield when entering the roundabout

definitions: circular building for housing and maintaining railroad locomotives
wide swinging punch delivered with a circular arm motion
examples: The historic roundhouse now serves as a railway museum
Steam engines were serviced in the roundhouse turntable
The boxer's roundhouse knocked out his opponent instantly
She practiced roundhouse kicks in her martial arts class

definitions: process of replacing a number with an approximate value for simplicity
act of making something curved or circular rather than angular
examples: Rounding decimals to whole numbers simplifies calculations
The rounding rules determine whether to round up or down
The carpenter focused on rounding the table's sharp edges
Rounding the corners improved the design's flow

definitions: meeting or discussion where participants have equal status and opportunity to contribute
examples: The roundtable brought together experts from various fields
Television roundtables analyze current political events weekly

definitions: systematic gathering of scattered livestock, people, or things
summary or collection of news, information, or events
examples: The annual cattle roundup took three days to complete
Police conducted a roundup of suspected gang members
The evening news featured a roundup of the day's events
Her blog posts weekly roundups of tech industry news

definitions: quality of stirring strong emotions, enthusiasm, or action in people
examples: The coach's rousing speech motivated the team to victory
The concert ended with a rousing rendition of the anthem

definitions: overwhelming defeat causing disorderly retreat of opposing forces
examples: The battle became a rout when enemy lines collapsed
The election was a complete rout of the incumbent party

definitions: way or course taken to get from a starting point to a destination
examples: The GPS calculated the fastest route to the airport
Historic trade routes connected distant civilizations

definitions: electronic device that forwards data packets between computer networks
power tool used to hollow out or shape wood and other materials
examples: The wireless router provides internet access throughout the house
Resetting the router often fixes connection problems
The carpenter used a router to create decorative edges
This router bit creates perfect dovetail joints
